revised_title: The Variability of Urine Acidity and its Relation to Diet
tldr: This article investigates the variations in urine acidity in a healthy individual and how it is affected by different types of food. The author found that urine acidity generally decreases after meals and increases before meals. The study also shows that animal food causes a more significant decrease in acidity compared to a mixed diet, while vegetable food has a less pronounced effect.
